text: Georgios Konstantinides (b. Trebizond, 1878 - d. Alexandria, 1919, nome-de- plume Skliros, , «Σκληρός») was an early Greek socialist, who published realist writing on the common reality of his time 90 Χρόνια Κομμουνιστικό Κόμμα Ελλάδας, Η σφραγίδα του στη Λογοτεχνία, Μηνιαίο Ένθετο για το Βιβλίο και τη Λογοτεχνία - Τεύχος 9 - Κυριακή 25 Νοέμβρη 2007 on the basis of the class structure of society and in order to analyse Greek society with Marxist tools, provoking discussions and struggles among the progressive circles of the day. ==Biography== Skleros was born to a middle-class family of Trebizond in Ottoman Pontus, and took a typical education and cosmopolitan outlook for the city and its Greek quarter of that age, and in his younger years travelled to Odessa in Russia to work as a merchant. Later he left for Moscow, where he engaged in medical studies, in 1904, at the University of Moscow. The following year he got involved in the revolutionary movement, under the influence of Georgi Plekhanov,Στο ίδιο . taking up the pseudonym of "Skliros" ("Severe"). A series of problems with the Tzarist establishment drove him to Estonia and then to Jena in Germany. There, as representative of Marxist theory he met with Dimitris Glinos in the "Filiki Prodevtiki Enosi" ("Friendly Progressive Unity"), a student society oriented in a socialist direction.Φίλιππος Ηλιού, «Δημήτρης Γληνός: Από την εκπαιδευτική μεταρρύθμιση στην κοινωνική επανάσταση», εφ. Τα Νέα, 8/2/2000. Skleros then moved to and lived in Alexandria, where he died in 1919. ==Works== *Το Κοινωνικόν μας Ζήτημα (Our Common Goal, 1907) *Η Φιλοσοφία του Πολέμου και της Ειρήνης (The Philosophy of War and of Peace) *Σύγχρονα Προβλήματα του Ελληνισμού (Contemporary Problems in Hellenism) *Μελέτες - παρεμβάσεις στα πολιτικά και πολιτιστικά δρώμενα (Plans - Interventions in Politics and Political Roles) ==References== Category:1878 births Category:1919 deaths Category:People from Trabzon Category:People from Trebizond Vilayet Category:Pontic Greeks Category:Marxist writers Category:Greek Marxists Category:Greek socialists
